TV Review: Agent Carter Series 2 Episode 3: 'Better Angels'

'Better Angels' is another baby step towards good television programming, handling the comedic elements better than before, but the show still has a long way to go, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Agent Carter Series 2 Episode 2: 'A View in the Dark'

The second episode of series two is an improvement on the first but the show still has a long way to go, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Agent Carter - Series 2 Episode 1: 'The Lady in the Lake'

The series two premiere of Agent Carter is disappointing despite establishing an exciting premise for the rest of the series, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 13: 'The Same Boat'

Keeping up with the brilliance that was last week's episode, 'The Same Boat' is an exciting ride from start to finish, says Liam Dooley

Rick's group takes the fight to the Saviours, but is that really a good idea? Liam Dooley reviews

Worlds collide when Alexandria meets the Hilltop Community. Liam Dooley reviews.

'The New World' introduces a new character and a new romance into the mix, but does it live up to the brilliant standard set by last week's episode? Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 10: 'Maveth'

The mid-series finale of Agents of SHIELD is truly disappointing, especially since it follows on from such a good episode, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 9: 'Closure'

This episode of Agents of SHIELD sets up the mid-series perfectly by tying up some loose ends and building up plenty of momentum, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 9: 'No Way Out'

The Walking Dead returns from the mid-series break and it is more intense, more brutal and much more deadly than even before, says Liam Dooley

The latest series of Endeavour came to a close this week and there wasn't a tiger in sight as Morse and Joan Thursday found themselves in the middle of a bank raid. Katy Sandalls reviews.

The penultimate episode of this series of Endeavour sees brooding detectives and big cats taking to the streets of Oxford. Katy Sandalls reviews

Lauren McNeilage completes her season long look at Hotel and in 12 episodes of shocked is particularly surprised that it ends on a happy note.

This week's Endeavour shrugged off the Gastby-esque glamour for the supermarket and DS Peter Jakes bids farewell. Katy Sandalls reviews.

As the season approaches its end, Hotel shows no signs of holding back, as evidenced by this gruesome and dramatic episode, says Lauren McNeilage

Katy Sandalls bucks popular trend, appreciating the way the latest Sherlock special succeeds, especially at engaging with previous iterations of the story.

TV Review: A Very Murray Christmas

Bill Murray's Christmas special begins very slowly, but then closes with an enjoyable dream sequence starring George Clooney and Miley Cyrus. Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 7: 'Chaos Theory'

With a villain so poorly developed that it deserves to be compared to the terrible Spider-Man 3, this episode of Agents of SHIELD was probably as bad as the show's awful first series, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 6: 'Among Us Hide...'

With a pointless character death and a highly artificial plot point wedged in to it, this episode of Agents of SHIELD is the worst one in the series so far, says Thomas Ron

A tough decision gives Hunter the chance to take centre stage for once in another decent episode of Agents of SHIELD, says Thomas Ron

Despite lasting all of 25 seconds, this recent episode of American Horror Story's ending has to be the best scene of the entire season says Lauren McNeilage

Aside from an unconvincing romance, this episode of Agents of SHIELD utilizes its characters perfectly, says Thomas Ron
